verses.roman:
tataḥ samekhale vīrau
saṁyuktāv itaretaram
jaghnatur vajra-kalpābhyāṁ
gadābhyāṁ raṇa-durmadau

synonyms: tataḥ—then; samekhale—on the level fighting grounds; vīrau—the two heroes; saṁyuktau—engaged; itara-itaram—each other; jaghnatuḥ—struck; vajra-kalpābhyām—like lightning bolts; gadābhyām—with their clubs; raṇa—by the fight; durmadau—driven to a mad fury.
translation: The two heroes thus began battling each other on the level fighting grounds outside the city. Maddened with the fury of combat, they struck each other with their lightning-bolt-like clubs.
